17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (11:30): Hmm, can a ZFS filesystem have different mountpoints in different zones?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (11:31): t see why not
17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (11:31): Just checking... my brain is trying to shut down for the night, so things are a bit fuzzy. :)

0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (11:33): Any directory, be it a plain directory or a ufs file system or a zfs file system or whatever, can be placed within any zone's file system space at any point by using the 'add fs' config option.
0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (11:34): So two zones can see different directories (to them) that are in fact the same directory on the global zone.

0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (11:38): If you are referring to giving a zfs file system to two different zones via the dataset option then I doubt that Solaris will allow it.  Haven't tried it, but doubt that it will work.

17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (11:51): What I'm looking to do is have a ZFS filesystem that contains directories to hold my (and my users) mp3s... from the global zone, my desktop, I'll have complete control, but from the zone where my users will log in I only need to have them able to add files into their own directories, and for a third zone I want the filesystem read-only.

0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (12:03): I'm guessing that you'll need something like 'add fs; dir=(local zone directory); special=(global directory where mp3's reside); type=lofs' on the zone where they are allowed to add mp3's, and a similar one but somehow specify that it's read-only for your third zone.

17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (12:06): *nods* That's what I seem to be gathering from the docs, though Sun's information on this is a bit vague at points.  It mentions that the filesystem needs its mountpoint set to legacy, but doesn't say if that's necessary in the global zone or just the non-global zones...
17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (12:07): http://docs.sun.com/app/docs/doc/817-2271/6mhupg6gj?a=view in particular is being confusing.
0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (12:08): The "mountpoint set to legacy" I take as meaning a zfs dataset that added to a zone, not a plain old directory.
0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (12:10): Do a typy=lofs rather then type=zfs.
17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (12:11): What differences will that create?
0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (12:11): It's not exporting the zfs dataset, just a loopback mount point to a directory.
0b29b1ddcf8f089e17880d45e102c326 (12:12): ... which happens to be a zfs file system, but that shouldn't matter.
17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (12:13): I will give that a shot tomorrow... thanks for the help, gramload.
17352d2e1d592b2f0610db85510f8012 (12:13): (Definitely need sleep... *sigh*)
